subject: %district% district - 12 CEHS indicators in %date%
body: This email provides you Data Insights on Essential Health Services in %district%

A couple of weeks ago, the first group of e-mails that offered you special insights into continuity of essential health services (CEHS) was introduced. Thank you very much for your feedback on this initiative.
We are now contacting you with the second analytical report that aims to show you what is happening in your district regarding the continuity of essential health services in %date%. In this first report, we focus on 13 indicators. Once you have thoroughly analysed this report, please fill in this survey to share your feedback. The next analytical reports will gradually contain new information regarding CEHS, based on your wishes (see 'Next Steps' below). We will also contact you shortly to set up a meeting, to discuss your feedback in more detail. Your efforts are of high importance to Ugandaâ€™s health response capabilities.
This analytical report is offered to you by the Sub-national Precision Public Health initiative from the Division of Health Information of the Ugandan Ministry of Health.

Methodological considerations are at the bottom of the report

The target value is then equalised to one (1) for simplicity.

Data source. The graphs and numbers shown in this report are generated based on data collected from DHIS2 and covering January 2018 up until %date%. It is important to note that all data shown here have been collected on the 27th of November. All data reported on a later date is not included in this email.
Data quality. Sometimes, these insights do not represent what is really happening in your district. There can be two reasons for that: (1) the data that was entered by your district was wrong data, (2) some health facilities or community health workers did not enter anything, or entered the data later than the 27th of November.
What does this all mean? As the numbers are sensitive to wrong data entry and low or late reporting rates, we need to keep a critical mindset when looking at these data insights. In order to improve the quality of data reports like these, health facilities might need additional support to improve reporting on all indicators in a correct way.

You are invited to analyze the CEHS data concerning your district, other districts and Uganda as a whole, on this dashboard: https://uganda-cehs.herokuapp.com/
Username: District_SPPH
Password: kWmxHcmAUM82

Next indicators. We aim to cover all the WHO-selected CEHS indicators and other relevant CEHS indicators in this series of monthly sub-national reports. The ones we are currently working on are related to maternal, natal and child health (MNCH), gender-based violence (GBV), malaria, non-communicable diseases (NCD), nutrition, tuberculosis (TB) and a few more on HIV. Which ones will come first, will partly depend on your feedback given in the survey and our meetings.
Date of the next report. As the numbers are sensitive to wrong data entry and low or late reporting rates, we need to keep a critical mindset when looking at these data insights. In order to improve the quality of data reports like these, health facilities might need additional support to improve reporting on all indicators in a correct way.
